page.title: 17Our Centenary B'ham
page.content: On Thursday 12th April 1984 it was our school Centenary. We had special guests like Sir Winston Churchill who is the great grandson of Sir Randolph Churchill. There was Mr Bennett the Headmaster before Mr Long, John Crawford the Chief Education Officer, the Bishop of Birmingham did not come. The choir sang 'The Lord's My Shepherd' and some of the juniors did a play in a school 100 years ago and in the future. Sir Winston Churchill presented a school clock to the oldest girl and the youngest boy. Then we went outside to have a photograph. We then saw dancing. I was in a gymnastic dance called 'Sailing.' There were other dances such as a Maypole dance, Square Dancing and Country Dancing. We had two cakes, one shaped like a 100 and the other was square.
